name: Zubeen Garg
description:
'''Zubeen Garg''' (born '''Zubeen Borthakur''' ({{IPA|as|zubin bɔɹtʰakuɹ}}; 18 November 1972 – 19 September 2025) was an Indian musician who primarily worked and sang in the [[Assamese language|Assamese]], [[Bengali language|Bengali]],  and [[Hindi]]-language film and music industries. He had also sung in 40 other languages and [[dialect]]s, including [[Bishnupriya Manipuri language|Bishnupriya Manipuri]], [[Adi languages|Adi]], [[Boro language (India)|Boro]], [[English language|English]], [[Goalpariya dialects|Goalpariya]], [[Kannada]], [[Karbi language|Karbi]], [[Malayalam]], [[Marathi language|Marathi]], [[Mising language|Mising]], [[Nepali language|Nepali]], [[Bhojpuri language|Bhojpuri]], [[Odia language|Odia]], [[Sanskrit]], [[Sindhi language|Sindhi]], [[Tamil language|Tamil]], [[Telugu language|Telugu]], and [[Tiwa language (India)|Tiwa]]. 

Garg was a [[multi-instrumentalist]] and played 12 instruments including [[anandalahari]], [[dhol]], [[dotara]], [[drum]]s, [[guitar]], [[harmonica]], [[Pump organ|harmonium]], [[mandolin]], [[Electronic keyboard|keyboard]], [[tabla]], and various [[percussion instrument]]s. He was regarded as one of the most influential musicians in Assam, and was also the highest-paid singer.
